snippet: Many students, tested through their senior year, failed standardized exams after the state revised its scoring criteria for the 2011-12 school year.
abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column analyzes Florida's steep drop-off in student testing scores after authorities introduced more rigorous standards in 2011; notes that Florida's Education Board, faced with public anger, eventually decided to undo the changes and revise the scores upward.
lead_paragraph: Many students, tested through their senior year, failed standardized exams after the state revised its scoring criteria for the 2011-12 school year.

headline.print_headline: Backtracking on Florida Exams Flunked by Many, Even an Educator
headline.seo: Florida Backtracks on Standardized State Tests
headline.main: Backtracking on Florida Exams Flunked by Many, Even an Educator
